intro: Illigera pentaphylla, commonly known as the five-leafed illigera, is a species of flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible seeds. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered white flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in mountainous areas with well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
